title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
Many employers are shrinking the number of paid weeks of maternity and paternity leave they will offer, survey data from the Society for Human Resource Management show.

Ford confirmed it is laying off roughly 3,000 white-collar and contract employees, its latest effort to slash costs as it makes a longer-range transition to electric vehicles.

Elon Musk's lawyers sent a subpoena to Jack Dorsey, the first indication that Twitter's co-founder and former CEO will be officially involved in the legal fight over Musk's stalled $44 billion deal.

McDonald's is shaking up its board with the departure of longtime member Sheila Penrose and the addition of three new directors.

Adidas said CEO Rorsted would step down next year, remaining in office until a new leader is appointed.

Toyota's chief rebuked the Hino commercial-truck unit over a scandal involving falsified fuel performance and emissions data.

What's News: Business & Finance
